C C gep coll ge d enseignement g n ral et professionnel Au Qu bec tablissement d enseignement postsecondaire qui dispense des programmes d tudes de niveau coll gial pr parant l entr e l universit formation pr universitaire de deux ans ou bien toutes sortes de m tiers formation technique de trois ans . Certificat Programme g n ralement compos de 30 cr dits de cours normaux de 1er cycle. Concordia offre plusieurs certificats de 1er cycle ces programmes ind pendants ne font pas partie d un cursus menant un grade mais peuvent normalement servir l obtention d un dipl me de 1er cycle. Code permanent Code attribu par le minist re de l ducation du Qu bec tout tudiant pour lequel une universit qu b coise re oit des fonds gouvernementaux. Coll ge Petite communaut d enseignement refl tant parfaitement l engagement de Concordia former des citoyens clair s pr ts apporter leur contribution la soci t . Les coll ges de Concordia proposent des environnements d apprentissage sp cialis s. Ils offrent une exp rience universitaire la fois int ressante enrichissante et stimulante. L enseignement et l apprentissage y sont abord s dans une perspective mondiale et multidimensionnelle. Consultez la foire aux questions. Cote de rendement au coll gial cote R La m thode de la cote R permet de comparer et de classer les candidats du c gep. Elle mesure l cart inf rieur ou sup rieur d un tudiant par rapport la moyenne de la classe avec des ajustements fond s sur la force relative du groupe dont il fait partie. Cours manquant Cours consid r comme obligatoire pour tre admis un programme donn mais que l tudiant n a pas encore suivi. Les cours manquants doivent tre termin s le plus t t possible durant le programme d tudes. Le cas ch ant deux options d sign es par les lettres A et B sont possibles pour combler le manque. Les tudiants en g nie et en informatique doivent terminer leurs cours manquants avant de s inscrire d autres cours. Cr dit Unit repr sentant un minimum de 45 heures r parties sur diverses activit s cours magistraux conf rences laboratoires travaux pratiques travail en studio stages examens et travaux personnels . Un cours donne g n ralement droit trois cr dits un trimestre ou six cr dits deux trimestres . temps plein les tudiants peuvent s inscrire un maximum de 15 cr dits par trimestre automne et hiver . Les programmes en g nie peuvent n cessiter plus de 30 cr dits. Les tudiants temps partiel peuvent s inscrire un maximum de 9 cr dits par trimestre automne et hiver . Comme les lignes directrices varient d une facult l autre on recommande l tudiant de v rifier dans l annuaire des tudes du 1er cycle ou l annuaire des cycles sup rieurs quelle structure s applique au programme qui l int resse ou de communiquer avec un conseiller p dagogique. D D partement Unit d une facult o s enseigne une discipline particuli re par exemple le D partement d tudes anglaises. Dipl me d tudes coll giales DEC Dipl me d cern par un c gep l issue d un programme de deux ou trois ans. Doctorat Ph. D. Grade le plus lev obtenu dans une universit il exige habituellement de trois cinq ans de recherche originale dans un domaine d tudes sp cialis . E Enseignement coop ratif coop Mod le p dagogique exp rientiel qui jette des ponts entre le milieu universitaire et le monde du travail. Il offre la possibilit d alterner trimestres d tudes et stages r mun r s dans un domaine ce qui profite grandement aux tudiants comme leurs employeurs. tudiant au 1er cycle tudiant inscrit un programme de baccalaur at ou de certificat temps plein ou temps partiel. tudiant aux cycles sup rieurs tudiant inscrit la ma trise ou au doctorat ou encore un certificat ou un dipl me de 2e cycle. tudiant libre tudiant inscrit des cours individuels normalement temps partiel pour sa culture personnelle par besoin professionnel par int r t pour un domaine particulier ou pour sonder le terrain avant d entreprendre un programme de 1er cycle temps plein ou partiel. tudiant visiteur tudiant actuellement inscrit dans une autre universit mais qui a re u la permission de celle ci pour suivre certains cours Concordia. Exemption Dispense accord e par l Universit Concordia lorsqu un tudiant termine avec succ s un cours pr cis et obtient la note minimale exig e pour ce cours. L exemption n est pas assortie de cr dits en vue de l obtention d un grade. Par cons quent le fait d en recevoir une n aura pas pour r sultat de diminuer le nombre de cours suivre pour obtenir un dipl me. Elle permet cependant de passer imm diatement un cours plus avanc . Les cours pour lesquels Concordia accorde des exemptions ne peuvent tre suivis en vue d obtenir des cr dits. Si l tudiant est exempt d un cours obligatoire dans son programme il devra le remplacer par un autre donn au m me d partement. Le cours suivre sera d termin en consultation avec un conseiller p dagogique. F Facult Unit d une universit o s enseignent des disciplines connexes par exemple la Facult des arts et des sciences ou l cole de gestion John Molson. G Grade Titre d cern au terme d un programme d tudes. H Honours Concentration de 60 cr dits ou plus obtenus dans une discipline. D excellents r sultats sont n cessaires pour y tre admis et y demeurer. Les programmes de Honours sont particuli rement denses et s adressent surtout ceux qui pr voient poursuivre des tudes sup rieures. En outre ils comportent souvent un projet final ind pendant ou un m moire. I Interdisciplinaire Une majeure interdisciplinaire est un programme compos de cr dits obtenus la suite de cours chevauchant plusieurs domaines. Les programmes de mineures interdisciplinaires comprennent habituellement moins de cr dits et doivent tre combin s avec un programme de majeure de sp cialisation ou de Honours d un d partement donn . L Lettre de motivation Bref document r dig par un candidat un programme d tudes expliquant les motifs de son choix ainsi que ses objectifs court et long terme et r sumant ses exp riences pertinentes de travail ou de b n volat. M Ma trise Deuxi me grade obtenu l universit apr s la r ussite d un programme sp cialis dans une discipline particuli re. La ma trise exige normalement deux ans d tudes et de recherche temps plein et le baccalaur at comme condition d entr e. Majeure Concentration de 36 cr dits ou plus sauf l cole de gestion John Molson o la majeure totalise au moins 24 cr dits dans une discipline en particulier en plus des 42 cr dits du tronc commun. Une majeure est un programme plus g n ral qui s applique une vari t de carri res et offre le plus de possibilit s d explorer en dehors de la discipline choisie. Mineure Concentration de 24 cr dits ou plus offrant une introduction la m thodologie et aux concepts cl s d une discipline ou d un champ d tudes l exception de l cole de gestion John Molson o la mineure totalise 12 cr dits dans une discipline particuli re en plus des 42 cr dits de tronc commun . Une seule mineure ou l accumulation de plusieurs mineures ne donnent pas droit un grade une mineure doit tre combin e une majeure une sp cialisation ou un Honours pour l obtention du dipl me. Vous n tes pas oblig de choisir un programme de mineure. Moyenne pond r e Moyenne calcul e la fin de l ann e universitaire t automne hiver condition que l tudiant soit inscrit des cours totalisant au moins 12 cr dits. Les tudiants doivent maintenir des r sultats scolaires satisfaisants comme en atteste cette moyenne. O Option l cole de g nie et d informatique Gina Cody on appelle les concentrations des programmes . La plupart de ces programmes offrent des options dans le cadre desquelles les tudiants suivent plusieurs cours li s un domaine choisi. P Programme grande capacit d accueil Programme dont la capacit d accueil est illimit e et qui applique les conditions minimales d entr e. Tous les candidats qualifi s sont normalement accept s. Programme inscription limit e Programme dont la capacit d accueil d passe l g rement les demandes d admission. Des crit res d entr e sont tablis et les candidats sont admis jusqu ce qu il n y ait plus de place. Programme contingent Programme dont la capacit d accueil peut tre inf rieure au nombre de candidats admissibles par exemple le programme de communication. L entr e est s lective et serr e et les dates de cl ture des candidatures sont rigoureusement respect es. Programme d tudes prolong es Les pr alables scolaires acquis par les candidats l admission qui viennent d tablissements situ s l ext rieur du Qu bec doivent se comparer ceux exig s des tudiants en provenance d tablissements qu b cois. Les tudiants qui n ont pas termin avec succ s un programme pr universitaire de deux ans peuvent tre admis au programme d tudes prolong es lequel exige l obtention d au moins 30 cr dits suppl mentaires. Ainsi le temps n cessaire pour terminer un programme Concordia sera le m me que celui requis dans tout autre tablissement universitaire l ext rieur du Qu bec soit environ quatre ans temps plein. Consultez l annuaire des tudes du 1er cycle pour conna tre les exigences relatives au programme d tudes prolong es pour chaque facult . Programme pour tudiants adultes Toute personne g e de plus de 21 ans d tenant la citoyennet canadienne ou le statut de r sident permanent et qui n a pas la scolarit pr universitaire normalement exig e peut pr senter sa candidature au programme pour tudiants adultes. Les entrants doivent satisfaire certaines exigences d admission. Ce programme exige l obtention d au moins 18 cr dits suppl mentaires par rapport au programme de grade normal 90 ou 120 cr dits . R R sident du Qu bec Le r sident du Qu bec inscrit dans une universit qu b coise paie des droits de scolarit moins lev s qu un tudiant d une autre province canadienne ou qu un tudiant tranger. Pour se pr valoir du bar me de frais en vigueur au Qu bec il faut d abord faire une demande de statut de r sident du Qu bec. L tudiant qui omet d obtenir ce statut devra acquitter des droits de scolarit plus lev s. S Sp cialisation Concentration de 60 cr dits ou plus qui permet d explorer un domaine en profondeur en vue d y faire carri re. Laissant une bonne latitude dans le choix des cours elle comporte dans certains cas une exigence de r sultats minimaux. En plus des cours dans un domaine donn la sp cialisation peut en comprendre dans des disciplines connexes. T Temps partiel Temps plein tudes Une ann e temps plein comprend 30 cr dits tandis qu une ann e septembre avril temps partiel en comprend 18 r partis galement sur deux trimestres. Possibilit d obtenir 12 cr dits pendant l t malgr un ventail de cours en g n ral plus limit . Transfert de cr dits Cours qui est normalement comptabilis en vue de l obtention d un dipl me et qui permet d courter un programme d tudes. Il est possible d obtenir un transfert de cr dits d un autre tablissement d enseignement postsecondaire ou lors d un changement de programme de grade Concordia. Par exemple vous tes titulaire d un dipl me d tudes secondaires obtenu avec une moyenne de C et ne fr quentez plus d tablissement d enseignement depuis 6 ans. Le titre de comp tences ne satisfait pas aux exigences minimales soit une moyenne de C . Vous pouvez donc pr senter une demande d admission comme tudiante ou tudiant adulte. Futurs tudiants Carrefour tudiant Dipl m s et amis Parents Personnel M dias Site search Concordia Directories Recherche Accueil Web Glossaire Coll ges instituts et coles FAQ Facebook Twitter LinkedIn Coll ges instituts et coles FAQ foire aux questions Qu est ce qu un coll ge un institut ou une cole La Facult des arts et des sciences de l Universit Concordia compte trois coll ges deux coles et deux instituts. Ces petites communaut s d apprentissage pr parent les tudiants s panouir hors des murs de l Universit ainsi qu assumer leur r le de citoyens du monde engag s. Ces unit s offrent une exp rience enrichissante stimulante et riche en d fis o enseignement et apprentissage sont abord s dans leur multiplicit l chelle mondiale. Les tudiants ont acc s diff rents programmes de honours de majeure de mineure et de certificat. Faut il choisir un coll ge un institut ou une cole lors de la demande d admission Non il s agit d une option facultative. Quel est l avantage de fr quenter un coll ge un institut ou une cole Ces unit s offrent une exp rience d apprentissage unique dans un cadre intime mais l int rieur d une grande universit . Comme elles favorisent les connaissances interdisciplinaires elles attirent des tudiants d horizons divers. Leurs membres ont notamment la possibilit de participer des conf rences et des s minaires sp cialis s. Leurs programmes constituent par cons quent une valeur ajout e non seulement lors des tudes mais aussi bien apr s l obtention du dipl me. Faut il remplir des exigences suppl mentaires pour l admission un coll ge un institut ou une cole Faut il consacrer davantage de temps ses tudes par exemple en suivant des cours additionnels Les exigences d admission varient d un programme l autre. Il incombe aux candidats de s informer en ligne des conditions d admission propres au programme de leur choix. Par ailleurs l appartenance l une de ces unit s n implique pas de suivre des cours additionnels. Les coll ges instituts et coles appartiennent ils tous une m me facult Tous les coll ges instituts et coles logent au sein de la Facult des arts et des sciences mais les tudiants des autres facult s peuvent y faire une demande d admission un programme de mineure si la structure de leur programme le permet . Future students Student hub Alumni friends Parents Faculty staff Media Site search Concordia Directories Search Student Hub Concordia.ca Students Records Transcripts Facebook Twitter LinkedIn Transcripts The Transcripts Department is a unit of the Office of the Registrar at Concordia University that manages official transcripts and related documents for current and past Concordia students. We will provide official records to you or other universities and institutions quickly and efficiently. Please contact us for any questions you may have transcripts concordia.ca Official transcripts An official transcript is a complete academic record bearing the University seal and signature of the Registrar. An official transcript includes all courses followed at Concordia with the exception of courses taken at the Centre for Continuing Education . The official transcript is issued in its entirety. Students and alumni may request to receive their Complete Undergraduate Graduate transcript or their Graduate Studies only transcript. W. McConnell Building opened in 1992 to house the R. Howard Webster Library teaching and research facilities the Leonard and Bina Ellen Art Gallery the J.A. DeS ve Cinema and academic and administrative offices. Beginning in 2006 and through 2007 some Social Sciences departments left their spaces in this building to move to the Hall Building and the Departments of English History and tudes fran aises were renovated and consolidated on the sixth and tenth floors.In 2013 the Birks Student Service Centre and the Welcome Centre located on the ground floor were fully redesigned and the DeS ve Cinema was upgraded. In 2015 the Department of Education was relocated to the Faubourg Sainte Catherine Building which allowed the library to expand onto the fifth floor to increase the seating capacity and adapt to technological change. The first phase of this project delivered that fall offers a variety of study spaces in a totally renewed setting. Future students Student hub Alumni friends Parents Faculty staff Media Site search Concordia Directories Search Student Hub Concordia.ca Students Co curricular Record Facebook Twitter LinkedIn Co curricular Record Stand out and get recognized The Co Curricular Record CCR is an official Concordia University document that recognizes your involvement beyond the classroom and highlights your complete university experience. A multitude of activities and positions are eligible for recognition on your Co Curricular Record. Such activities include student leader roles volunteer positions on campus student led initiatives In addition to being an official record of your involvement while at Concordia having a CCR offers you many benefits. It can be used to help your professional development to demonstrate competencies and transferable skills that have been cultivated through your engagement in student life. This valuable tool can be used along with your cover letter and resume graduate school application bursary and scholarship application Student Guide Staff Faculty Guide Search our activity directory Verify a record Stamp of Approval You will find the CCR stamp of approval icon on approved activities. This confirms that it can be added to your record. The stamp is available to staff faculty and students to be used on promotional materials. Contact us if you would like to use the stamp for your activities. CCR in Canada Many post secondary institutions across Canada have either implemented the Co curricular program or are in the research phase. Concordia University is a member of the Canadian Association of College University Student Services CACUSS Co Curricular Records Community of Practice. Important deadlines Final date to add positions to your co curricular record for this academic year is May 1 2022 at 11 59 p.m. Final date to have positions validated for this academic year is May 31 2022 at 11 59 p.m. Activities are only accepted for the CURRENT academic year requests for previous academic years will not be processed. Future students Student hub Alumni friends Parents Faculty staff Media Site search Concordia Directories Search Student Hub Concordia.ca Students Co curricular Record Student guide Facebook Twitter LinkedIn Student Guide Helpful step by step guides useful tips on building your CCR and how to articulate skills gained. CCR database guides Guide to adding a position to your CCR Guide to adding a new position to the CCR database Guide to validate What is a CCR The Co Curricular Record program is designed for students in order to highlight their involvement beyond the classroom. The database features many activities where students can take part in positons of personal interest or professional development. Each position is associated with learning outcomes and are validated by a validator. This official document can be printed and used as a tool to demonstrate competencies and transferable skills that have been cultivated through engagement. What are the benefits to building a CCR Employment Having a CCR helps you demonstrate the skills you have earned and gives you a competitive edge in the job market. Students with a CCR can state their experience in the appropriate sections of their resume and can include their official record with their resume when applying to jobs. In job interviews when asked to provide an example of when you demonstrated a particular skill you can reference the experience on your CCR. Applications Your CCR can be used in applications for jobs graduate schools and bursaries scholarships. Leadership A CCR shows initiative to gain valuable skills outside the classroom and demonstrates a dedication to making a difference in your community. Community involvement Many CCR activities are based in community engagement and employers are always looking for candidates who make a positive difference in their communities. There are many diverse and transferrable skills from volunteering to employment. What positions are eligibility for the CCR Regardless of the activity it must meet the following criteria to be eligible for the CCR. Encourage and support student growth and development It cannot be an activity required for academic credit Positions cannot be paid It must be connected to an on campus opportunity Only activities for the current academic year will be accepted What positions does the CCR recognize There are four areas the CCR recognizes Clubs and associations Campus and community engagement Leadership and professional development Student led initiatives What are learning outcomes Each position has a selection of learning outcomes which appear on the record. It can be used to help professional development in order to demonstrate competencies and transferable skills that have been cultivated through engagement. Being Adaptable Flexible Planning Organizing Communications Skills Leadership Management Leveraging Technical Assets Problem Solving Social Responsibility Self Awareness Positive Attitude Collaboration Multicultural Awareness Appreciation of Diversity How do I access my Co curricular record View your Co Curricular Record. You can also find this link in My CU Account. How do I get copy of my record Access your Co Curricular Record. You can also find this link in My CU Account. Click Co curricular record on the left hand dashboard Bottom right of the screen there are three dots. Click it. Select Print my Co curricular record A PDF will be created and you can save it. What does it mean when a position is pending Pending means the position has not been approved by the validator. Once a position is added to your record an automatic email is sent to the validator advising them a validation has been requested. All validators have until May 31 to validate. How can I connect my CCR experience to the job I am applying to When preparing whether it be applying for a job or a job interview refer to your CCR for experiences which can demonstrate employability skills such as problem solving collaboration and effective communication. Make a list of the learning outcomes you developed during your participation in the CCR activity Write down a few examples of how you exhibited those skill during your participation Identify key skills and experiences required listed in the job description Can I add a position from last year to my record Only activities for the current academic year will be accepted. How do I become a validator If you would like to become a validator for a position that is already in the CCR database send an email to co curricular concordia.ca. Log in and you ll be placed in a waiting room and the advisor will get to you when it s your turn. Exactly like dropping by the ISO but virtually. At 10 a.m. join the Zoom rooms and wait for an ISO advisor to get to you. Please make sure to enter your student ID and your name when logging in. Please note Please be patient and stay in the meeting room once you have entered it. If you leave the waiting room you may not be able to get back in. If the room is full or locked try going back in later Tuesdays from 10 00 a.m. to 11 30 a.m. Room 1 Tuesdays from 1 00 p.m. to 3 30 p.m. Room 1 Wednesdays from 1 30pm to 3 00pm Room 1 Thursdays from 10 00 a.m. to 11 30 a.m. Session cancelled on Thursday December 16 2021 Room 1 In person at the ISO ISO advisors will be available on Tuesdays and Thursdays at the International Students Office GM 330 from 10am to 4pm except Thursday December 16 2021 This is a drop in schedule so there is no need to book an appointment to meet with an ISO advisor. Please make sure to bring any document s that may be relevant to your situation physically be in Montreal as this is an in person visit Do not come to the International Students Office if you are experiencing any COVID symptoms such as fever chills or feel feverish a sudden loss of smell without nasal congestion with or without loss of taste a recent cough or a worsening chronic cough any difficulty breathing or shortness of breath a sore throat any contact with a confirmed case of COVID 19 in the last 14 days have you been diagnosed with COVID 19 or been adviced by Public Health to isolate or quarantine in the last 14 days If you are experiencing any of the symptoms above you can join a Virtual Drop in Session. You must wear a procedural mask at all times at the International Students Office. Graduate programs Join a community of graduate students who question the status quo and push their work beyond disciplinary boundaries in over 120 graduate programs. Find your program Interdisciplinary programs Students at Concordia have multiple ways of breaking disciplinary boundaries through a variety of interfaculty and intersecting programs and initiatives. Learn more Individualized program Pursue specific research goals outside our existing graduate programs. INDI programs give you access to resources within and across faculties so you can develop a deeper understanding of a research problem. More about INDI C Teach certificate Design your own program and explore your passions in an environment that provides enough structure to stay on track. Learn more Inter university agreements Create international collaborations that strengthen the quality of your PhD research. Cotutelle allows you to pursue a doctoral degree at Concordia and a partner institution giving you exposure to diverse educational and cultural practices. Learn more Open courses Broaden your graduate experience by taking a course in a program with cognate interests. Consult the open courses list for ways to apply your disciplinary expertise to another academic area. VIEW OPEN COURSES Summer courses Take part in an interdisciplinary seminar led by acclaimed faculty members from Concordia and other universities. Experiential learning activities let you experiment with cutting edge research. Site search Concordia Directories Search Graduate admissions Questions about grad programs Connect with a recruiter Prepare to apply Choose aprogram Check the application deadlines Review the requirements START AN APPLICATION Application tips Apply early by gathering and composing the required documents for your application. Select referees who can provide a strong recommendation and review with them the requirements of reference letters and academic assessment forms. Ensure all required documents and information are submitted by the application deadline. Write a statement of purpose describing for example your motivation academic interests and professional goals. Non Canadian residents should apply for the Certificat d acceptation du Quebec CAQ and a Canadian study permit as soon as you receive your offer of admission. Are you ready Apply now Already applied How long does it take to assess my application The admissions process varies for each student and program. We cannot give specific dates for a decision. You can check your application status online anytime in My Student Centre.Check your application status Graduate application deadlines The deadline to submit your application depends on your program. Give yourself plenty of time to prepare your application and collect required documents. We reserve the right to close admission to a program at any time after the official deadline without prior notice. Find your program s application deadline Deadlines for additional program requirements Many programs have departmental requirements that you must satisfy in addition to Concordia s minimum admission requirements. Additional requirements might include portfolios auditions interviews letters of intent etc. You must make arrangements to submit these additional requirements with the department you apply to. Please consult the specific program page for more information on these requirements. Academic year timetable The academic year is based on three terms summer fall and winter. Term Dates Important notes Summer May August Start of the academic year Fall September December 15 weeks Regular point of entry for most graduate programs Winter January April 15 weeks Certain programs accept students in January based on availability Covid 19Please refer to the School of Graduate Studies FAQs for information specific to graduate studies. Benefit from workshops on career building leadership and management and software and web tools. Site search Concordia Directories Search Graduate admissions TUITION FUNDING Tuition fees The tuition fees may differ depending on the program and your student status. To estimate the cost of your education at Concordia use the tuition fee calculator. TUITION FEE CALCULATOR Visit the tuition fees page for additional details on how tuition fees are calculated. Awards funding Competitive funding packages in the form of awards teaching and research assistantships are offered at the time of admission to most thesis based students to allow them to focus on their research and studies. Students are automatically considered for all entrance graduate awards when they apply to Concordia provided they meet eligibility criteria. No separate application is required. ENTRANCE AWARDS The Quebec and Canadian governments offer a number of competitive graduate scholarships. We encourage you to apply for these awards at the same time you are preparing your application. PROVINCIAL FEDERAL AWARDS Montreal advantage When you study at Concordia University you will thrive in Montreal a vibrant and cosmopolitan city centre. We have affordable tuition and one of the lowest costs of living in North America. Learn more about life and cost of living Awards scholarships bursariesOnce you submit your application you are automatically considered for all entrance graduate awards. Benefit from over 1 400 annual awards including generous scholarships financial support for conference travel and incentives to graduate sooner.Learn more about graduate funding Scholarships for international students As a non Canadian resident you may be eligible for international fee exemptions that allow you to pay Quebec tuition rates. Other funding opportunities include doctoral research scholarships postdoctoral fellowships short term research or professional development scholarships and much more. Read about international fee exemption Work opportunitiesIf you are in financial need the Work study program funds part time jobs on campus. Eligible students may work up to 20 hours per week to a maximum of 200 hours per semester in administrative research or technical positions.Find a job on campus Teaching research assistantshipsMany graduate students receive support in the form of a stipend paid by a department or a faculty member holding a research grant. Once admitted your Graduate Program director or thesis supervisor can discuss the openings with you. Practical experience Gain valuable industrial and professional experience while you study. International internships allow you to undertake research in various countries such as Brazil Mexico Spain and Uganda while co operative programs offer opportunities for you to work across various sectors. Learn more about Co op Learn more about international internships See yourself here Attend an orientation session to get aquainted with the range of services for Concordia students and how they can make your life easier. Here are some essentials. Phase 1After you apply Phase 2Newly admitted Phase 3Before classes begin Phase 4Starting your first term Find key tools and support and start university with confidence 1 Put Concordia online platforms to use Much of the information that you ll need to know about your classes is at your fingertips with these online tools. Student Hub Your Student Hub provides easy access to digital tools personal information services and resources and more. My CU Account is where you will register for courses update your personal information access your academic requirements report view your exam schedules and see your grades after each term. It is also where you will be able to view your tuition and other fees. Moodle Moodle is where your professors share their course outlines along with other class materials. Once the term begins be sure that all the classes you re taking show up in your Moodle account. You may not see your courses in Moodle until the first day of each of your classes. Udemy Access a collection of over 4 000 online courses for free at Udemy. Courses ranging from IT operations web development leadership and management marketing and project management and operations. Office 365 If you haven t already consider activating your Concordia email account which will give you free access to the Office 365 suite of tools. Useful links Student Hub Moodle Udemy How to view your academic requirements report Concordia Office 365 accounts 2 Waitlists drop deadlines Once the term begins monitor your waitlisted courses and swaps carefully. Make sure you know and understand the DNE and DISC deadlines. Waitlist You may have joined the waitlist for a class. As other students adjust their schedules at the beginning of term you may automatically be enrolled in the waitlisted course. If you had set up the swap function you ll also automatically drop another course. Review the swaps you set up to make sure they still fit with your plans. Withdrawing from a course The DNE deadline which stands for Did Not Enter is the date by which you can officially withdraw from a course without having to pay for it. If you drop a course before this deadline it won t appear on either your student record or official transcript. Discontinuing a course If you want to drop a course after the DNE deadline you can as long as it s before the DISC deadline short for Discontinued . While it won t affect your GPA grade point average discontinuing a course will result in a DISC notation on your student record and official transcript. You will also need to pay the tuition fee for the discontinued course. Deciding to stop attending a course is not the same as dropping a course. If you do not drop a course and simply stop doing the coursework and participating you will receive a failing grade. Useful links Term dates and deadlines How to use the waitlist feature PDF How to use the swap function PDF 3 Pay tuition fees Paying your tuition fees on time means no late fees and no library or registration holds. Paying tuition fees Fall tuition is due September 1 and the final payment deadline is September 30. You can pay your tuition fees by online banking pre authorized debit credit card or using CIBC International Student Pay. You can see the breakdown of your tuition fees in your Student Centre. You re automatically enrolled in Concordia student health insurance which is included in your fees. Questions If you have questions about your tuition fees you can contact the Student Accounts office for support. Useful links Review your tuition Tuition payment deadlines Tuition payment methods How fees are billed Health insurance cost breakdown GSA Health insurance cost breakdown ISO 4 Ensure you have these key tools Having your Student ID card and textbooks in place at the beginning of term is essential to a smooth start. Student ID card Your student ID card will allow you to access the campus shuttle get a student rate OPUS card to take public transit and access certain campus buildings. While COVID 19 health and safety measures are in place having a student ID is optional. Otherwise every Concordian is required to have one. Book Stop You can find out which books are required for your courses by reading the course outline in Moodle or by consulting your personalized student book list on the Concordia BookStop bookstore web page. You can also confirm with your professor once classes have started. You can buy course packs and textbooks on the Book Stop web page. Course reserves Many professors put the required readings on course reserves at the libraries meaning you can borrow them for short periods during which you can scan and email assigned pages to yourself. Professors will let you know in your course outline if readings are on reserve at the libraries. Useful links Getting a student ID Concordia Book Stop Concordia Library course reserves Explore services and resources 5 Connect with other students Orientation and Grad Chat are great opportunities to get to know new people. You can even join sports teams fitness classes and social activities for Concordia students. Orientation Orientation events are an excellent way to meet other new students from your Faculty and across the university. You will discover all of the amazing student groups and learn about ways to get involved. Whatever your interests there s something for you. Grad Chat Grad Chat is a one hour weekly session where Concordia s new and returning graduate students can meet one another and join in a friendly community. Sports Under normal circumstances you have over 200 intramural sports to choose from while Concordia is remote you can join an intramural e Sports team to meet new people. You can also stay active with online group fitness classes offered by Recreation and Athletics which are free for Concordia students. Other opportunities More opportunities to connect Regular social events organized by the International Students Office and the Otsenh kta Student Centre and the Welcome Crew student mentors who can offer advice on adapting to university life. You can also browse the Student life pages to find more ways to get involved. Useful links Orientation Grad Chat Welcome Crew Group events for new students Recreation and Athletics International Students Office social events Otsenh kta Student Centre Student Life 6 Finalize admissions related requirements If you have any documents left to submit now is the time to do it. If your offer letter included a request for an official transcript from your final term send it to the Concordia admissions office as soon as possible. If you re an international student be sure you ve uploaded your immigration documents CAQ Study Permit passport to your Student Centre as soon as they are available. Useful links Student Centre Submitting official documents International Students Office 7 Discover your support network Feeling overwhelmed confused or simply in need of some practical advice Peer and professional staff in advising academic support and physical and mental health are here for you. Student mentors Connect with our student mentors from the Welcome Crew. They are knowledgeable current students who are happy to share their experience and help you find the information you are looking for. You can also request to be paired with a staff Navigator for help identifying and accessing the services and support you need. GradProSkills GradProSkills is a hub for campus resources tailored for Graduate students. This service offers free workshops events and online tools to support your academic success and professional development. Participating in GradProSkills activities augments you grad school experience expands your network and prepares you for the next phase in your career. Other student services The Student Success Centre can help you cultivate strong time management and study skills as well as support your personal and career development. Health and Wellness focuses on your mental and physical health and first year support counselling is available if you re finding the transition to Concordia more challenging than anticipated. Reach out to these or other student services at any time. Assistance Your Graduate Program Director supervisor or Graduate Program Assistant can lend assistance with course planning and your program and degree requirements. For questions about your coursework you can always contact your professors by email. Professors also host virtual office hours which are a chance to discuss your assignments and learn more about their expectations of you in the class. Having trouble If you re having trouble you can always contact the Instructional and Information Technology Services IITS service centre either by phone at 514 848 2424 ext. 7613 or email at help concordia.ca. Birks Student Services Centre is also a fantastic resource for help with university policies and procedures. Site search Concordia Directories Search Welcome Guide for New Graduate Students Concordia.ca School of Graduate Studies Welcome Guide for New Graduate Students Before classes begin Before classes begin A bit of advance planning always pays off. These preparations will help you start your first term feeling organized and ready. Phase 1After you apply Phase 2Newly admitted Phase 3Before classes begin Phase 4Starting your first term Here s how to prepare for a successful beginning of term 1 Join us on social media Meet your classmates before classes start by joining the New Concordians Facebook group and connecting with student associations. Join us on Facebook The New Concordians Facebook group is open to all new students. Connect with like minded students Become a member of a student association where you can begin making connections with your future classmates. Find associations on social media before the term begins to find out about kickoff events. Keep abreast of GradProSkills opportunities Connect with GradProSkills on Facebook to discover free professional development opportunities and academic supports exclusively for graduate students at Concordia. For international students International students can also follow the International Students Office on Facebook to keep up to date on important deadlines and events organized just for you. Concordia communities To catch news and updates for the entire Concordia community follow Concordia University on Facebook Instagram and Twitter. Useful links New Concordians Facebook group Concordia student groups and associations GradProSkills on Facebook International Students Office on Facebook Concordia Student Experience Facebook Page 2 Connect with Concordia Take a virtual tour connect with student mentors and get to know some of your peers through Grad Chat. Meet Welcome Crew mentors Welcome Crew mentors are here to help you transition easily into your first year at Concordia. You can reach them by phone email or video chat to talk about anything from the course registration system to where to meet new friends. Chat with grad students Want to connect with students in different departments Have a few questions you wish you could ask a current student Connect with new and returning graduate students on Grad Chat. Book a virtual tour Picture yourself on campus by booking a virtual tour of Concordia s two campuses. You can book a virtual visit guided by a current Concordian who can answer your questions and provide some tips on must see places in Montreal. For students with children The Concordia University Student Parents Centre provides an accessible space to study but also a place to share interests and develop a support network for students with children. For indigenous students First Nations Inuit and M tis students can access academic and community resources at the Otsenh kta Student Centre. For Black students The Black Perspectives Office offers services and resources to Concordia students from Black communities. For international students The International Students Office offers resources and services for international students. Useful links Welcome Crew mentors Grad Chat Concordia virtual tours Student Parents Centre Otsenh kta Student Centre Black Perspectives Office International Students Office Get involved in student life Explore Montreal walking tours 3 Activate Concordia tech accounts Set up your Concordia email Moodle and related student accounts now so that once classes start you will be tech ready. My CU Account You can find quick access to your computer accounts and passwords via the Student Hub. Navigate to My CU Account select the Personal information accounts tab and click on View computer accounts passwords. Office 365 Every student has access to a Concordia email address and although using one is not mandatory it s highly recommended. It will grant you free access to Microsoft Office 365 a super useful suite of tools that you might otherwise have to pay for. You can activate your email account just before the term starts. Moodle eConcordia You ll use the Moodle platform to submit assignments participate in classroom discussion forums and more. If you are registered for eConcordia classes you will need to activate your eConcordia account. Useful apps Downloading the following apps onto your phone can help you stay connected. The Concordia app is an easy way to view your courses check your grades and consult the shuttle bus schedule. The Guardian app helps keep Concordians safe and inform students of any system outages. Keep track of your health insurance with the Studentcare Bluecross app app and access your Moodle courses on your phone with the Moodle app. Useful links Getting Office 365 from Concordia Moodle eConcordia accounts Rave Guardian app Studentcare health plan 4 Organize your student tools Your student ID and OPUS card will help you get around town and you might consider renting a locker and getting set up with DPrint. Student ID card Your student ID card will allow you to access the Concordia shuttle when campus is open get a student rate OPUS card to take public transit and access certain campus buildings. While COVID 19 health and safety measures are in place having a student ID is optional. Otherwise every Concordian is required to have one and you can get yours 48 hours after registering for your first course. Renting a locker When campus is open some students find it helpful to rent a locker. You can select which building your locker is located in. Rental periods last for a year and payment is made by credit card. DPrint account Another useful service when campus is open DPrint allows you to print and make photocopies at Xerox machines located around campus. You can add funds to your DPrint account which is linked to your student ID card at machines located at both Vanier and Webster Libraries and in the Print Shop. Book Stop Before the beginning of the semester start checking out which books are required for your upcoming courses. Professors may have already made the course outline which includes book lists available on Moodle. You may also find your personalized student book list by checking the Concordia Book Stop web page where you can order or rent print or digital books. Useful links Student ID card Renting a locker DPrint information Concordia Book Stop Your personalized book list 5 Plan your transportation Whether by car or bike on foot or by bus here s what you need to know to get around Montreal. OPUS card If you plan to take public transportation in Montreal you may want to buy a monthly OPUS card. To get a reduced student rate you must have a Quebec home address saved in your Student Centre and be registered full time for the current term. BIXI bike sharing Biking is a quick and convenient way to get around and the SGW Campus is located right on the Maisonneuve bike path. BIXI is Montreal s seasonal bike sharing service and there are often discounts on subscriptions for Concordia students. Shuttle bus The Concordia Campus Shuttle connects the downtown SGW Campus with Loyola Campus and is free for Concordia students just show your student ID as you board . When campus is open the shuttle departs approximately every half hour from both campuses. Parking on campus Parking permits are available for students on the Loyola Campus and hourly parking is available first come first served in several locations at the SGW Campus. Useful links Getting an OPUS card BIXI Montreal Bike parking on campus Shuttle bus schedule Parking permits Commuting services and resources 6 Review your courses schedule Before classes start ensure your schedule is aligned with your academic program. Consult the Graduate Calendar your offer of admission or speak to your Graduate Program Director Assistant or supervisor for support. Graduate Calendar Check the Graduate Calendar anytime to make sure you are taking the required courses for your program and to read course descriptions. It s the definitive source for understanding academic rules and regulations as well as which courses you ll need to complete your degree and program requirements. Be sure to review any information related to deficiencies indicated in your offer of admission. This information may affect your course registration. Depending on your program your Graduate Program Director supervisor or Graduate Program Assistant can help you understand general degree requirements Faculty rules transfer credits and more. Useful links Graduate Calendar Graduate program contacts Student Centre 7 Attend orientation events Orientation and welcome events are hosted by Concordia and take place before and during the start of term. Here s how to join the action. Orientation Orientation is designed to help students from all faculties dive into the university experience meet other new students and build up study strategies needed for a smooth start. The university wide Orientation generally takes place just before classes start and is currently offered entirely online. Program specific information sessions Some academic departments host program specific information sessions to give new students detailed instructions a chance to meet their staff or professors and often see the facilities they will be using before classes start. If your department does this you will receive a specific email invitation. Individualized support We encourage you to participate in as many events as you can to get the full orientation experience. If you need more individualized support with the transition to Concordia try the MAP to Success sessions hosted by our first year support counsellor through GradProSkills. You can also connect with student mentors on the Welcome Crew or join Grad Chat at any time. Student associations At the start of term Concordia s student associations organize various welcome events. These focus on meeting and making friends with students from your new faculty through virtual scavenger hunts movie nights student club fairs and more. Follow your association s social media accounts for details. Useful links Orientation Group activities and events for new students First year support counselling Welcome Crew Grad Chat Virtual campus tours 8 Sexual Violence Awareness Training To help foster a safe environment for all of us every Concordian must complete this Sexual Violence Awareness Training. It Takes All Of Us is a mandatory training program that everyone at Concordia including faculty completes every year as part of our ongoing efforts to maintain a safe and respectful environment. It covers topics such as consent bystander intervention and supporting survivors. All students must complete the training around the middle of their first term. DEADLINE You must complete the training by the appointed deadline within your first term. Access the training or check your completion status via the Mandatory training section of My CU Account in the Student Hub. Future students Student hub Alumni friends Parents Faculty staff Media Site search Concordia Directories Search Academic Community Conduct IT TAKES ALL OF USMandatory Sexual Violence Awareness and Prevention Training Module descriptions Training deadlines Online training Virtual in person training FAQ Additional questions Why awareness and training matter We have created mandatory sexual violence awareness and prevention training in our ongoing efforts to foster a safe and respectful environment at Concordia. As our community continues to learn and grow new modules will be added. Currently two modules are offered to Students Staff and Faculty either as online training or in person virtual workshops Introductory Module The training in this first module is preventive in nature and explores the basics of sexual violence. A definition and examples of sexual violence is offered along with information and tools regarding consent bystander intervention and supporting survivors. Throughout the module participants will engage with various scenarios. Finally information on our policies and processes as well as internal and community resources is offered. Systems of Oppression and Intersectionality This second training module focuses on a root cause of sexual violence systemic power and intersectionality. These concepts are presented to participants using a tool called the Anti Oppression tree followed by various scenarios allowing for deep exploration of the topic. Creating a safe environment for everyone Sexual violence awareness and prevention training is fundamental in creating a safe and supportive working and learning environment at Concordia and is a legal requirement as outlined by Bill 151. Content Warning The in person virtual workshops require active participation including discussion with other participants. While the facilitator of each session will do their best to create a safe space for respectful discussion they cannot guarantee other participants will not use triggering or problematic language. These sessions make use of Zoom breakout rooms which may not have a facilitator present thereby increasing the risk of encountering triggering or problematic language from others. If you think this kind of situation is unsuitable for you to learn we encourage you to use the online module. If neither of these options is suitable for you please get in touch with the Sexual Assault Resource Centre to discuss accommodations. To Complete the Training Information about how and when to complete the training The training will be offered in two formats users can choose to take either the online e learning Module accessed through MyConcordia or participate in an in person virtual workshop using Zoom. Either format fulfills the mandatory requirement Students All students are required to do training once when they arrive at Concordia and are encouraged to continue their learning by completing new modules as they are released. All new students must complete the Introductory Module within the first 6 weeks of the semester. Deadline for Fall 2021 October 12 2021 Faculty and Staff All new Faculty and Staff must complete the Introductory Module within 6 weeks of their hire date. Visit the It Takes all of Us Training link in your MyConcordia Portal to view your deadline and status. Deadline for Fall 2021 October 12 2021 Yearly Requirement All Faculty and Staff are required to complete annual training for sexual violence awareness and prevention. New content will be released each year at the beginning of May and a generous timeline for completion will be given. Specific dates for completion will be communicated each year. Deadline for Fall 2021 October 12 2021 Online Access online training by logging in to MyConcordia. Use of Chrome is recommended. Take the training now Virtual in person A number of in person virtual group training sessions are offered by the Sexual Assault Resource Centre SARC . Registration is required. Student Introductory Module for all new students September 17th 2021 1 00pm 3 00pm FULL September 24th 2021 10 00am 12 00pm FULL September 29th 2021 1 00 3 00pm FULL September 30th 2021 3 00 5 00pm FULL October 8th 2021 2 00 4 00pm FULL Register today Staff and Faculty Introductory Module September 9th 2021 3 00pm 5 00pm September 22nd 2021 1 00pm 3 00pm Register today Staff and Faculty Module 2 Systems of Oppression and Intersectionality September 14th 2021 10 00am 12 00pm September 15th 2021 1 00pm 3 00pm September 17th 2021 10 00 12 00pm September 21st 2021 3 00pm 5 00pm Register today Frequently asked questions FAQ Why is everyone at Concordia required to take sexual violence awareness and prevention training It takes all of us safety and respect are community wide responsibilities. Sexual violence awareness and prevention training is a legal requirement as outlined by Bill 151. As a result it is the responsibility of everyone in the community to complete the training. What does the training cover The content of the sexual violence awareness and prevention training is preventive in nature and focuses on Consent Bystander intervention Supporting survivors and Information on our policies and processes. New module for returning staff faculty focuses on Systems of Oppression and Intersectionality What is the deadline to complete the training All new students whether undergraduate or graduate must complete this mandatory training by October 12 2021. All faculty and staff members who joined Concordia after October 31 2020 must complete this mandatory training by October 12 2021. Returning staff and faculty are required to take new modules to deepen their understanding of the subject matter. How long does the training take to complete The Introductory Module takes between 45 and 60 minutes to complete. The additional module on Systems of Oppression and Intersectionality takes approximately 20 30 minutes to complete. The in person virtual group training offered by the Sexual Assault Resource Centre SARC takes 1.5 hours. Space is limited and registration is required. What happens if I don t take the training by the deadline Sexual violence awareness and prevention training is a legal requirement as outlined by Bill 151. As a result all Concordia faculty staff and students must complete the training. Cases of faculty and staff who do not comply with this mandatory requirement will be addressed through the respective collective or employment agreement or policy. Students whether new or returning undergraduate or graduate who have not completed the training by the deadline will have a block placed on their student account that will prevent registration for future semesters unless the training is completed. How do I know whether I have successfully completed the training If you have not received confirmation by email and or wish to check your status log on to MyConcordia.ca and click on It Takes All of Us Training to view your completion records for all modules. What if I am uncomfortable taking training on sexual violence awareness and prevention Where can I get support The training is a legal requirement that is not optional but we understand this can also be a sensitive topic that can impact people in different ways. Questions and concerns can be sent to mandatory training concordia.ca Those seeking in person support are encouraged to reach out to the Sexual Assault Resource Centre by calling the SARC Service Assistant at 514 848 2424 ext. 5972. Within the online version of the training I see a button labelled I m feeling overwhelmed . What is that button for Within the online version of the training the I m feeling overwhelmed button is there for people who are experiencing distress because of the content of the training. Once the button is clicked information regarding immediate support will pop up. The button allows the viewer to exit the part they are finding distressing and to move ahead to the next section. The expectation remains that the training be completed by the deadline.Those who continue to experience significant distress are encouraged to reach out to the Sexual Assault Resource Centre so that they can go over the training content in a one on one setting. I am having technical problems completing the online version. Whom can I contact Those experiencing technical issues in completing the online version of the training should contact Concordia s IITS help desk. Does everyone take the same training No there are two different training modules one for students and another for employees. All students including those who work at Concordia as research assistants and teaching assistants as well as students hired to work on time sheets or short term contracts are required to do the student module. NOTE Faculty and staff will need to take the training every year while students only need to take it once during the course of their studies. What if I am a faculty or staff member who is on leave Faculty and or staff members who were on leave will be obliged to take the training when they return. Whom do I contact if I have questions or concerns Please send all questions or concerns to mandatory training concordia.ca. In order to ensure timely and effective responses please include your student and employee Netnames in all communications. I am a faculty member and or staff why am I being asked to do more training As required by Concordia policy and in compliance with Bill 151 all staff and faculty are required to do training each year. Each year a new module will be released which will explore a new topic related to sexual violence. Everyone is encouraged to do the new module however you may re take the introduction module if you prefer. You are also welcome to take or re take any module at any time throughout the year as you wish. I am a student employee. Is there additional information I should know about Yes as a student employee you play an integral role in upholding the University s committment to fostering a safe and respectful learning environment. That s why it s imperative for you to read and understand this additional information for student employees at Concordia University. What has changed in the MyConcordia Portal The MyConcordia landing page has been updated to serve you better You will notice the removal of the It Takes All of Us Status link. Your completion status and deadlines are now clearly indicated within the landing page when you click It Takes All of us Training. For any questions regarding your completion please contact mandatory training concordia.ca. Future students Student hub Alumni friends Parents Faculty staff Media Site search Concordia Directories Search Academic Community Conduct Student employeesMandatory Sexual Violence Awareness and Prevention Training Additional information for student employees at Concordia University Concordia University is committed to fostering a safe and respectful learning environment and as a student employee you play an integral role in upholding this commitment. In your role as a student employee you need to be aware of the power you could potentially hold over students how power dynamics can complicate consent and the behaviours that can lead to an unhealthy learning and working environment. Finally you need to know about the Consensual Romantic or Sexual Relationship Guidelines at Concordia University. Power dynamics The mandatory training on sexual violence awareness and prevention also known as It Takes All of Us training provides information about consent and the situations that can complicate consent. If you have not yet completed this training please do so as soon as possible by following the It Takes All of Us Training link in your MyConcordia portal. Power dynamics such as those between students and instructors may create an environment in which consent is complicated due to the power an instructor has over a student s grades athletic opportunities or employment. For example can a coach and an athlete have a relationship if the coach has power over the athlete s career Can a teaching assistant and a student have a relationship if the teaching assistant can influence the student s grades The athlete and student in these examples might feel pressured to do things they do not want to because of these power dynamics. The types of power you hold as a student employee can also be influenced by systemic forms of power held in categories such as race gender ability class age and education. It is important to remember that the impacts of these dynamics are far reaching and exist because of the way many identities are systemically discriminated against and given less validity. You need to be aware of any biases or prejudices that arise in your interactions due to these power dynamics. Learning environment Part of your role as a student employee is to help create a healthy learning and working environment. Creating this healthy environment for students means having ethical relationships that are conscious of power dynamics as well as understanding the behaviours that may result in an unhealthy environment. Here are some examples of behaviours that can result in an unhealthy learning and working environment and that can create an uncomfortable environment for students Seeing students outside of university hours especially off campus Inviting students to personal engagements Offering mentorship to students based on a romantic interest Commenting on students appearance Making sexual comments or jokes Making advances Flirting Guidelines In January 2018 Concordia University released the Consensual Romantic or Sexual Relationship Guidelines. The guidelines strongly discourage all instructors from commencing or continuing any consensual romantic or sexual relationship with a student. The guidelines define Instructor and Student as follows Instructor Any university employee who is teaching advising supervising mentoring overseeing the allocation of resources to and or coaching students. Such employees include but are not limited to full and or part time faculty members faculty administrators librarians laboratory or other instructors principal investigators as well as teaching assistants research assistants staff members and coaches and coaching assistants. Student Any person registered in a course or program on a full or part time basis for credit or not and includes undergraduate and graduate students independent students as well as visiting students exchange students and interns. Important excerpts from the guidelines Whenever an instructor is or in the future might reasonably become responsible for teaching advising allocating resources or supervising a student or more generally is or in the future might reasonably be in a position to exercise authority over a student Romantic or sexual relationships between them should be avoided and If such a relationship is not avoided any existing or past romantic or sexual relationship constitutes an actual or perceived conflict of interest and must be disclosed pursuant to the present guidelines. Student employees can disclose to their direct supervisor. Please consult the guidelines for more information on where and how to disclose a conflict of interest. Thank you for taking the time to review this important information for student employees. We are committed to ensuring you fully understand your responsibilities as a student employee. If you need clarifications have questions or concerns please email mandatory training concordia.ca. Future students Student hub Alumni friends Parents Faculty staff Media Site search Concordia Directories Search Academic Community Conduct Concordia.ca Academic Community Conduct Sexual violence Systems of Oppression and Intersectionality Training Module Systems of Oppression and Intersectionality Training Module Deepen your knowledge on the roots of sexual violence As a Concordia student you have by now completed the introductory module of the It Takes All of Us sexual violence awareness and prevention training. You are now encouraged to deepen your knowledge of this subject matter by taking the latest module developed by Concordia s Sexual Assault Resource Centre SARC called Systems of Oppression and Intersectionality. Understanding the roots of sexual violence Though not mandatory for students taking this module is an excellent way to learn about the role of power dynamics as a root of sexual violence. Sexual violence is not about sex and desire it s about power explains Jennifer Drummond manager at SARC. Unequal power dynamics impact how sexual violence is experienced and create barriers for survivors when it comes to reporting misconduct and accessing support. Systems of Oppression and Intersectionality takes 30 minutes to complete and touches on the following subjects Systems of oppression and how they contribute to the root causes of sexual violence The definition of intersectionality and how it relates to power dynamics and sexual violence How to intervene when we see or hear sexual violence around us Methods of support that take into account marginalized or oppressed survivors Building on momentum Since 2019 more than 73 000 faculty staff and students have taken It Takes All of Us. For Lisa White executive director of the Equity Office this speaks to the Concordia community s commitment to this issue. It s heartening to see the community response to mandatory training over the last few years. Staff and faculty who have already taken the base module were asked to take the new one in September and responded in overwhelming numbers she reports. I encourage all students to take the time to learn more about the roots of oppression and intersectionality. Take the Systems of Oppression and Intersectionality training module now. Future students Student hub Alumni friends Parents Faculty staff Media Site search Concordia Directories Search Office of the Provost and Vice President Academic Concordia.ca Office of the Provost VP Academic Key initiatives Task Force on Sexual Misconduct and Sexual Violence Report of the task force on sexual misconduct and sexual violence Facebook Twitter LinkedIn Report of the task force on sexual misconduct and sexual violence Introduction Alan Shepard President of Concordia announced the establishment of the Task Force on Sexual Misconduct and Sexual Violence in January 2018 as part of a coordinated response to allegations of sexual misconduct at the university. The task force began its work in March 2018 with weekly meetings that focused on reviewing relevant university policies and procedures relevant legislation and presentations from key members and units of the university community. Through these meetings and presentations along with a survey community conversations and open calls for feedback from stakeholders the task force was able to identify common themes and establish priorities. The recommendations in this report fall into the following five key areas 1. Policies and Procedures 2. Training and Education 3. Support and Services 4. Communications 5. Standing Committee on Sexual Misconduct and Sexual Violence Given the university s commitment to addressing sexual misconduct and sexual violence it is important for us to be self reflective and open to change. The task force recommendations serve as stepping stones to a larger cultural shift that is required to ensure that the community knows how to support victim survivors that those affected have the tools they need to make informed decisions and above all to bring about the safest and most flourishing environment possible for the whole Concordia community. The task force would like to thank all individuals and groups who contributed to this important process. En tant qu tudiantes et tudiants employ s vous jouez un r le int gral dans le maintien de cet engagement. ce titre vous devez tre conscients du pouvoir que vous pourriez potentiellement exercer sur les tudiants de la mani re dont la dynamique du pouvoir peut compliquer le consentement et des comportements pouvant mener un milieu d apprentissage et de travail malsain. Enfin vous devez conna tre les directives concernant les relations romantiques ou sexuelles consensuelles l Universit . Dynamique du pouvoir La formation obligatoire sur la reconnaissance et la pr vention de la violence caract re sexuel galement connue sous le nom de formation a nous concerne tous fournit de l information sur le consentement et sur les situations qui peuvent compliquer celui ci. Si vous n avez pas encore suivi cette formation veuillez le faire le plus t t possible en cliquant sur le lien It Takes All of Us Training dans votre portail MyConcordia. La dynamique du pouvoir comme celle entre les tudiants et les enseignants peut cr er un milieu o le consentement est compliqu en raison du pouvoir qu un enseignant exerce sur les notes les possibilit s sportives ou l emploi d un tudiant. Par exemple un entra neur et une athl te peuvent ils entretenir une relation si l entra neur exerce un pouvoir sur la carri re de l athl te Une assistante d enseignement et un tudiant peuvent ils entretenir une relation si l assistante peut influer sur les notes de l tudiant Dans ces exemples l athl te et l tudiant peuvent se sentir forc s de faire des choses qu ils ne veulent pas faire en raison de la dynamique du pouvoir. Le type de pouvoir que vous exercez en tant qu tudiantes et tudiants employ s peut galement d pendre des formes syst miques de pouvoir exerc es selon diverses cat gories telles que la race le genre les habilet s la classe l ge et l ducation. Il importe de souligner que cette dynamique a des r percussions d une grande port e et existe en raison de la mani re syst mique dont nombre d identit s font l objet de discrimination et voient leur validit r duite. Vous devez donc tre conscients de tout pr jug susceptible d merger dans vos interactions du fait de la dynamique du pouvoir. Milieu d apprentissage Votre r le titre d tudiantes et tudiants employ s consiste en partie favoriser la cr ation d un milieu d apprentissage et de travail sain. Au regard des tudiants cela signifie entretenir des relations thiques qui tiennent compte de la dynamique du pouvoir et comprendre les comportements qui peuvent r sulter en un milieu malsain. Voici quelques exemples de comportements qui peuvent r sulter en un milieu d apprentissage et de travail malsain et cr er un environnement inconfortable pour les tudiantes et tudiants fr quentation d tudiantes ou tudiants en dehors des heures d ouverture de l Universit notamment hors du campus invitation d tudiantes ou tudiants des rendez vous personnels offre de mentorat des tudiantes ou tudiants en raison d un int r t romantique commentaires sur l apparence d tudiantes ou tudiants commentaires ou plaisanteries de nature sexuelle avances flirt. Directives En janvier 2018 l Universit Concordia a publi des directives concernant les relations romantiques ou sexuelles consensuelles. En vertu de ces directives il est vivement d conseill tout enseignant d entreprendre ou de poursuivre une relation romantique ou sexuelle consensuelle avec un tudiant. Les termes enseignant et tudiant y sont d finis comme suit. Un enseignant est une personne employ e par l Universit qui enseigne des tudiantes ou tudiants les conseille les supervise les mentore les entra ne ou g re l allocation de ressources qui leur sont destin es. Sont compris mais sans s y limiter les membres du corps professoral temps plein ou temps partiel les administratrices et administrateurs qui font partie du corps professoral les biblioth caires les monitrices et moniteurs de laboratoire ou autres et les chercheuses et chercheurs principaux de m me que les assistantes et assistants d enseignement les assistantes et assistants de recherche les membres du personnel les entra neuses et entra neurs et les entra neuses et entra neurs adjoints. Un tudiant est une personne inscrite un cours ou un programme temps plein ou temps partiel cr dit ou non ce qui comprend les tudiantes et tudiants de tous les cycles les tudiantes et tudiants libres les tudiantes et tudiants visiteurs les participantes et participants un programme d change ainsi que les stagiaires.
